page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: Eyeworth Pond served as a reservoir for the gunpowder factory. The spring that feeds the pond, known as Ironswell has orange water and used to be bottled to bathe the eyes. Bramshaw Telegraph was one of a chain of semaphore stations erected in 1795 to send messages from London to Plymouth and stood until 1880. Ashley Walk This area was enclosed as a bombing range for training purposes in World War II. The first "blockbusters" were dropped to estimate possible damage, a large circular concrete area still stands. It was used as a marker for tests.
